com.github.gwtd3.api
Class JSON

java.lang.Object
  com.github.gwtd3.api.JSON

public class JSON
extends Object

A convenient builder to build JSONObjects instances. Use the append(java.lang.String, boolean) methods to appends simple property values.

Use the enter(String) method to append a child JSONObject as a property value. Use the exit() method to go back to the parent object.

For instance: 

 JSON.create("start","value")
 .enter("child")
 .append("childProp","v")
 .exit()
 .append("end","value");

will generate the following JSON: 

 {
        start:"value",
        child:
                {
                childProp:"v"
                },
        end:"value"
        }
TODO: Jsonarray

Author:
Anthony Schiochet
